question: <image 1> This isn't related to plant diseases, but it's crucial for the production of potatoes. Can you tell me if either of these two insects, or maybe even both, are harmful to potatoes?
options: The one with black coloured antennae
The one with tan coloured antennae

index2ans.B: The one with black coloured antennae
index2ans.C: The one with tan coloured antennae

question: <image 1> What is the count of pathogens infecting this sunflower leaf?
options: I don't know and I don't want to guess

index2ans.E: I don't know and I don't want to guess

question: <image 1> What could be the reason behind the massive gum production on the trunks of these grapefruit trees in Cyprus, even though they appeared healthy when observed from a higher point on a hillside?
options: Harvesting damage when cutting with knives

index2ans.D: Harvesting damage when cutting with knives

question: <image 1> Which among the following assertions holds true?
options: Laboratory work with micro manipulators can mimic the transmission of viruses.
All plant feeding insects can transmit viruses.
All plant viruses can be transmitted by insects.
Most viruses have a specific relationship with their vectors.
I don't know and I don't want to guess

index2ans.A: Laboratory work with micro manipulators can mimic the transmission of viruses.
index2ans.B: All plant feeding insects can transmit viruses.
index2ans.C: All plant viruses can be transmitted by insects.
index2ans.D: Most viruses have a specific relationship with their vectors.
index2ans.E: I don't know and I don't want to guess

question: <image 1> What among the listed issues would not be the cause for the petioles of this rhubarb splitting?
options: I don't know and don't want to guess.

index2ans.C: I don't know and don't want to guess.
